thread.title: High school football roundup
thread.title_full: High school football roundup - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: High school football roundup
text:
CLASS AA
Shenendehowa 42, Ballston Spa 7
Player of the game: Shenendehowa's Carl Fiore finished with 17 carries for 215 yards and found the end zone three times to top the Plainsmen's offense.
Play of the game: Toward the end of the second quarter, Fiore broke off a 25-yard touchdown run, but it was called back because of a holding penalty. On the next play, he broke it up the right side and eluded three defenders for a 35-yard touchdown.
Stat of the game: Shenendehowa's defense stopped Ballston Spa four times on fourth down in the game.
Notable: Vince Gramuglia picked off a pass and ran it back 27 yards for a touchdown for Shen. ... Nathan Fankhanel went 6-for-6 on extra-point attempts. ... Griffin Wallner totaled 10 carries for 70 yards and a touchdown for the Plainsmen.
Guilderland 34, CBA 6
Player of the game: Cameron Long had 100 yards of total offense and scored three times to lead the charge for Guilderland.
Play of the game: On 3rd and long from the 40-yard line, George Marinopoulos heaved a ball down the sideline to Cameron Long, who reached up over a defender, tipped it to himself, and after a brief juggle, caught it for a touchdown.
Stat of the game: Guilderland's defense held the CBA offense to just 45 yards in the second half.
Notable: Thomas Majkut had an interception and two sacks for the Dutchmen. ... Stefan Brantley added two sacks, and Timothy Pasquini and Marquis Chisom had one apiece. ... Greyson Heyward recovered a fumble for CBA, Brian Tucker had three sacks and Quincy Venable added two more sacks.
Columbia 35, Schenectady 8
Player of the game: Columbia sophomore Joe Meehan intercepted two passes, bringing one back for a touchdown, to lead the Blue Devils .
Play of the game: Meehan intercepted a pass and returned it 35 yards for a score in the first quarter to open up a 16-0 Columbia advantage.
Notable: Columbia quarterback Steve Lindemann threw two touchdown passes, both to receiver Jesse Simoni . ... Columbia improved to 3-2 and 2-1 in the Liberty Division . ... Schenectady falls to 1-4 and 0-3 in the division.
Saratoga Springs 69, Albany 29
Player of the game: Senior Justin Degener scored three touchdowns, including a kick return for a score, for Saratoga Springs.
Play of the game: Dakota Harvey returned the opening kickoff 82 yards for a touchdown to start the Blue Streaks' rout.
Notable: Six different players scored for Saratoga. ... The Blue Streaks kept their undefeated record intact and moved to 5-0. ... Albany remains winless at 0-5.
Bethlehem 14, Colonie 13
Player of the game: Ben Tietjen had 25 carries for 76 yards and recorded an interception to help pace Bethlehem.
Play of the game: With 1:30 left in the game, Colonie had 3rd and 14 at the Bethlehem 19-yard line, but Chris Harvey intercepted a pass in the end zone to seal the victory.
Stat of the game: Bethlehem's defense caused five turnovers.
Notable: Taylor Pfaff scored on an 80-yard fumble recovery in the first quarter for Colonie. ... Leo Siy caught a 36-yard pass from Ryan Starr for the go-ahead touchdown in the third quarter. ... Bethlehem improved to 3-2 overall and 2-1 in the division. Colonie fell to 0-5 and 0-3.
CLASS A
Mohonasen 48, Bishop Maginn 28
Player of the game: Mohonasen's Nate Stillson scored six touchdowns and threw for another to lead the Mighty Warriors' attack.
Play of the game: Stillson picked off a pass and raced 73 yards for a score to start a 21-point quarter for Mohonasen and help put the game away.
Notable: Stillson finished with five rushing touchdowns for the Mighty Warriors. ... Receiver Joseph Galusha was the only other Mohonasen player to score a touchdown.
Troy 51, Averill Park 7
Player of the game: Damani Soares rushed 14 times for 131 yards and three touchdowns. He also caught three passes for 53 yards and a touchdown.
Play of the game: Dev Holmes had a 56-yard touchdown run in the fourth quarter. Holmes zig-zagged down the field on the way to the end zone.
Stat of the game: Troy piled up 460 yards of total offense.
CLASS B
Lansingburgh 42, Albany Academy 7
Player of the game: Danny Lopez rushed 15 times for 159 yards and three touchdowns.
Play of the game: Lopez's 34-yard touchdown run halfway through the third quarter got Lansingburgh on the board and tied the game. Lansingburgh then erupted for 35 more unanswered points in the second half.
Stat of the game: Lansingburgh rushed for almost 390 yards, most coming in the second half. Lansingburgh is 4-1, Albany Academy drops 2-3.
Schuylerville 34, Cobleskill 14
Player of the game: Derek Willson rushed for 67 yards and two scores to lead Schuylerville.
Play of the game: Joseph Vanderhoof broke a 35-yard score to close a 27-point first quarter for the Black Horses.
Notable: Vanderhoof finished with 77 yards on just four carries for Schuylerville. ... The Black Horses totaled 337 yards on the ground.
CLASS C
Granville 27, Lake George 14
Player of the game: Trace Bourne rushed 12 times for 84 yards and two touchdowns and threw for two touchdowns. He also had an interception.
Play of the game: Bourne's 58-yard touchdown run late in the first half gave the Golden Horde a 19-6 lead.
Greenwich 28, Corinth 13
Player of the game: Mike Brandow rushed 21 times for 150 yards and three touchdowns for Greenwich.
Play of the game: With 7:35 remaining in the third quarter, Brandow took a pitch to the left sideline, cut back to the middle of the field and raced 78 yards for a touchdown to put Greenwich up 21-7.
Stat of the game: Corinth outrushed Greenwich 282-191.
Notable: Corinth's Alex Jenkins had 85 yards and a score on the ground. ... Greenwich moved to 5-0. ... Corinth dropped to 3-2.
CLASS D
Warrensburg 30, Rensselaer 14
Player of the game: Joe Sousa rushed for 105 yards and three touchdowns for Warrensburg.
Play of the game: On Warrensburg's first possession, Jake Nemec took a handoff up the middle, broke two tackles and went 56 yards for a touchdown.
Stat of the game: Warrensburg rushed 44 times for 389 yards and five touchdowns.
Turning point: Warrensburg executed a successful onside kick to start the second half and parlayed the play into a Don Stone 32-yard touchdown run.
NONLEAGUE
Amsterdam 47,Niskayuna 13
Player of the game: Amsterdam's Bryan Stanavich ran for 225 yards on 17 carries and scored four touchdowns (three rushing, one receiving) to lead the Rugged Rams to victory.
Play of the game: Stanavich broke loose for a 76-yard touchdown run in the third quarter that put the game out of reach.
Turning point: After a 59-yard Ismail Stewart run on the first play from scrimmage, Niskayuna couldn't cash in and turned the ball over on downs. Amsterdam scored five plays later and never looked back.
Coxsackie- Athens 14, Hudson 6
Player of the game: Zach Peterson totaled 18 carries for 100 yards to pace Coxsackie-Athens.
Play of the game: Zach Girvin opened the scoring with a 23-yard run in the first quarter to put the Indians up 6-0.
Stat of the game: Girvin finished with 102 yards of offense.
Notable: One of Hudson's top rushers, Mike Alert, did not play because of a hip injury. ... Donovan Peck recorded a pair of sacks for Hudson. ... Girvin had 12 carries for 61 yards and a touchdown.
